Interface Maze

public interface Maze

An interface for Maze object.

Method Detail

getPixelItem

MazeItem getPixelItem(int x,
                      int y)
Get the MazeItem object at the tile containing the pixel (x, y). See Pixel Coordinate for the meaning of (x, y).

Parameters:
x - – the x coordinate
y - – the y coordinate
Returns:
MazeItem

getPixelItem

MazeItem getPixelItem(java.awt.Point pixel)
Get the MazeItem object at the tile containing the pixel (x, y). See Pixel Coordinate for the meaning of (x, y).

Parameters:
pixel - - a Point object representing (x, y)
Returns:
MazeItem

toMatrix

MazeItem[][] toMatrix()
Get a matrix representation of the tiled maze. The matrix will be an arrays of rows. Each tile will be an element of the matrix.

Returns:
A 2D Array of MazeItem ojects

getTileItem

MazeItem getTileItem(int tileX,
                     int tileY)
Get the MazeItem object at the tile position

Parameters:
tileX - - the column index of the tile in the maze matrix
tileY - - the row index of the tile in the maze matrix
Returns:
MazeItem

the total number of uneaten dots on the maze

                     int tileY)
Check if a given tile is accessible to Pacman

tileX - - the column index of the tile in the maze matrix
tileY - - the row index of the tile in the maze matrix

isAccessible

boolean isAccessible(java.awt.Point tile)
Check if a given tile is accessible to Pacman

Parameters:
tile - - a Point object representing (column index, row index) of the tile
Returns:
boolean

getAccessibleNeighbours

java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getAccessibleNeighbours(java.awt.Point tile)
Get accessible neigbouring tiles of a given tile Only directly adjacent tiles are neighbouring tiles

Parameters:
tile - - a Point object representing a tile (column index, row index)
Returns:
a List of neighbouring tiles

isIntersection

boolean isIntersection(java.awt.Point tile)
Check if the given tile is an intersection. An intersection must have 3/4 directions going out of it. It must also be accessible to Pacman.

Parameters:
tile - - a Point object representing (column index, row index)
Returns:
boolean

isCorner

boolean isCorner(java.awt.Point tile)
Check if the given tile is a corner. A corner must have only 2 directions going out of it, and the 2 directions must be perpendiculars. It must also be accessible to Pacman.

Parameters:
tile - - a Point object representing (column index, row index)
Returns:
boolean

isStraight

boolean isStraight(java.awt.Point tile)
Check if the given tile is a straight passage. A straight passage tile must have only 2 directions going out of it, and the 2 directions must be parallel (opposite directions). It must also be accessible to Pacman.

Parameters:
tile - - a Point object representing (column index, row index)
Returns:
boolean

isDeadEnd

boolean isDeadEnd(java.awt.Point tile)
Check if the given tile is a dead end. A dead end tile must have only 1 direction going out of it. It must also be accessible to Pacman.

Parameters:
tile - - a Point object representing (column index, row index)
Returns:
boolean
